channel.title: VPS Java run CMD error. 13 rep to whoever fixes
channel.description:
Mkay, so I just bought a new VPS for Xythax and everything I've tried on it works, all ports that need to be opened are opened, compilers are working. The only problem is that when ever I try to run the server, I get this error that I've never seen in my life.
[code] 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . . [/code]
Whoever solves it gets 13 reppyreprep.
Just to show it off, here's my new vps: [img]http://www.speedtest.net/result/2024014278.png[/img]

item.title: VPS Java run CMD error. 13 rep to whoever fixes
item.dc:creator: @Dean313 Dean313
item.description:
@Dean313 wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:17, topic:446450”]Reverse your previous statement.

Also, 8/10 people know I’m a website developer, who specialises in php, not a java programmer.[/quote]You don’t have to be a java programmer to realize that you didn’t set your paths correctly. You’re just a moron.

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Java run CMD error. 13 rep to whoever fixes
item.dc:creator: @The_Djinn The Djinn
item.description:
@The_Djinn wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:17, topic:446450”]Reverse your previous statement.

Also, 8/10 people know I’m a website developer, who specialises in php, not a java programmer.[/quote]

Okay, 8 out of 10 people? What’s your point? specializes in PHP? From taking a look at your website, I see nothing on it that make’s you a ‘professional’ with PHP. Besides the login. Which is pretty simple to do, also the registration if you actually made a database for it or made it register with the Vbulletin you’re using which is still some what easy to do.

You also tell me to reverse my statement above, then tell me you’re not a java programmer, you’re pretty much implying you’re wrong and/or you don’t know. The only Java Programmer I can actually vouch for you on your development team would be Rodgerwilco, since I’ve known him for a very long time. Other than that, you have no team.

I’m done posting on this thread now, don’t want to make it some war. I’ll bring it to PM if I continue.

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Java run CMD error. 13 rep to whoever fixes
item.dc:creator: @The_Djinn The Djinn
item.description:
@The_Djinn wrote:

A batch file has nothing to do with a Runescape private server. They also aren’t ‘included’ inside your IDE. It just detects the path to your JDK/JRE.

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Java run CMD error. 13 rep to whoever fixes
item.dc:creator: @The_Djinn The Djinn
item.description:
@The_Djinn wrote:

Wow. Just do a direct path.

Ie: “C:/Program Files/Java/JDK/bin/Java.exe”

Or set the variables. /Facepalm

You also need JDK.

Read full topic

item.source: VPS Java run CMD error. 13 rep to whoever fixes

item.title: VPS Java run CMD error. 13 rep to whoever fixes
item.dc:creator: @soapface soapface
item.description:
@soapface wrote:

Goto, Control Panel -> System -> Advanced tab
Click on environment variables
Look at the below fieldset, System FieldSet
Find value PATH or Path, double-click on it and add the Java binary folder location at the end

;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_10\bin

If you don’t have jdk 1.6.0_10/bin change it to whatever you have.

or

Set variables; But,
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe”
instead of java, if 64 bit, add (x86) to program files.

Read full topic
item.source: VPS Java run CMD error. 13 rep to whoever fixes

item.title: VPS Java run CMD error. 13 rep to whoever fixes
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

javaw gets replaced with “C:\program files\java\jre6\bin\javaw.exe” - If Windows can’t find that, you obviously need JRE.

Also, look here:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Java run CMD error. 13 rep to whoever fixes
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

LearningToCode1:

Have you changed your jdk(jdk version here)?? Or maybe you havn’t set your enviroment variables

It isn’t a compiler, it doesn’t run with jdk. Here’s my run code here:

@echo off
title Client
javaw -Xmx300m client
pause
